title: Who are we
text:
The network is currently composed of about 64 members from 45 institutions in 22 countries. Current members include early career researchers (e.g. PhD candidates), researchers later in their careers, and everything in between.



Members of the network in earely 2023


A steering committee helps coordinate the development of the network. The committee currently consists of 7 members:

Ceres Barros (University of British Columbia, Canada)
Laura E. Dee (University of Colorado, Boulder, USA)
Mike Fowler (Swansea University, UK)
Owen L. Petchey (University of Zurich, Switzerland)
Samuel R.P-J. Ross (Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology Graduate University, Japan)
Takehiro Sasaki (Yokohama National University, Japan)
Hannah J. White (Anglia Ruskin University, UK)

title: Join
text: If you would like to chat about joining the network, or for any other reason contact us, please fill in and submit this google form. Someone from the network will then get in touch as soon as possible.

title: About
text:
The aims of the Response Diversity Network currently include:

To organise and accelerate scientific advances about response diversity.
To promote the inclusion of response diversity in monitoring and assessment of biodiversity change.
To provide clear and accessible information about response diversity to relevant individuals and organisations.

The network should evolve, and as it does, these aims and how they are approached can evolve as well. The process for such change should be as open and inclusive as possible.

title: Network formed
text: Those involved in the scoping discussions were enthusiastic about such a network, for its potential to coordinate meta-analyses, to overcome longstanding challenges, to coordinate collection and curation of response traits, to help mix theory and empiricism, and because “networks are almost always a great thing!”. Numerous other opportunities and challenges were discussed and can be viewed in the notes from the scoping meeting. Based on the enthusiasm and support expressed in the scoping discussions, the decision was made to start the network! Every network needs a logo, so we quickly got to work on that, and you can see the result in the top left of this web page.

title: Steering committee meeting
text: Six new members joined in the last month. Priorities remain agenda setting via a positioning report; questions for a survey that could form the basis of the positioning paper were discussed and refined. Regarding network communication, it was decided to be as open as possible, e.g., that steering committee meeting minutes would be open. [The minutes of this second SC meeting are here.]()

title: Steering committee formed
text: Following the decision to [form the network](hyperlink to post), people in the scoping discussions and also those not attending were informed of the decision and invited to express their interest to participate in the network Steering Committee. Numerous individuals volunteered and the steering committee was formed with a diverse selection of those volunteers. [The past and present members of the steering committee are given here.]

title: Steering committee meeting
text: The first meeting of the network steering committee was held on 7th December 2022. [The minutes of this first SC meeting are here.]() In brief, there was a update about membership, notification of a possible response diversity focused workshop in Japan in 2024, discussion of early priorities. The decision was made to start work on a positioning report that would lay out the concept of and need for a Response Diversity Network. The membership were informed and work began!
